conclusion: Analyze the cyclic process of the ideal gas focusing on the path from state C to state D.
The image shows a pressure-volume (p-V) diagram for a cyclic process of an ideal gas with states A, B, C, and D. The volume decreases from V/L = 4 to V/L = 3 from state C to D.
Identify the process path from state C to state D with constant pressure of p = 0.75 × 10^5 Pa.
Calculate work done using the formula W = -P · ΔV for an isobaric process.
Substitute values into the formula: W = - (0.75 × 10^5 Pa) × 1 L.
Determine the sign of work as positive from the perspective of the external environment.
Calculate the numerical value of the work done: W = 75000 J.
